intro: Ruellia novogaliciana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia novogaliciana thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
